result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua A Jinkerson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua A Jinkerson in court, in custody.  Attorney Grace Hagerman for Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Joshua A Jinkerson.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 2:02 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment. Record by Atty. Hagerman who enters not guilty pleas on behalf of the defendant and requests status out about 60 days. Court sets as requested.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua A Jinkerson in court, in custody via telephone from Rock co. Jail.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for Joshua A Jinkerson.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to be released tomorrow. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Minutes filed.
Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua A Jinkerson appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane appears with defendant.. Called @ 2:04 p.m. Clerk has difficulty with Rock County and cannot get defendant on the phone (keeps getting disconnected). Court waives the defendant's appearance. Record by Atty. Daane who asks that matter be set on for waiver of preliminary hearing on a call. Court sets as requested and Defendant may appear by phone for next hearing. Court in recess.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Joshua A Jinkerson not in court. Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grace Hagerman appeared for defendant. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant is in Rock County in custody. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua A Jinkerson appeared by phone from the Rock County Jail. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender.  Victim present and advises the court they've requested to have the no contact lifted.  State does not object to lift the no contact.
Initial Appearance scheduled for August 19, 2022, at 1:15 p.m.
**AMENDED 08-12-2022:  No contact amended to no violent contact.**

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua A Jinkerson not in court. Bond motion on file, victim in court. Set over tomorrow for a bond motion hearing. Minutes filed.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Victim's request to lift the no contact
Signed bond filed with the court.

**AMENDED 08-12-2022:  No contact amended to no violent contact.**
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.J.Y. dob 7-10-1973 or RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Joshua A Jinkerson in court, in custody by video. Samuel Berg appeared for the State. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant referred to SPD. Defendant is on PO hold. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
